channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Michelle Obama shares her styling hacks that make her confident and allow her to ‘do the work’
item.description: The attorney and former U.S. First Lady never follows trends, wears outfits that make her feel beautiful, and tailors all her clothes to make differen...

item.title: Investment alarm bells ring: For the first time in 20 years, AI bubble fears have fund managers saying companies are overdoing it
item.description: Even Wall Street thinks this has gone too far. Some 202 panelists managing $550 billion in AUM are raising a concern unseen since 2005, according to B...

item.title: Billionaire tech founder Joe Liemandt says getting an MBA isn’t worth it and you don’t learn a ‘fraction’ of what you would as an entrepreneur
item.description: When asked by podcaster Codie Sanchez if people should get an MBA, Joe Liemandt promptly said “no.”

item.title: Gen Z college students have found a new cheat code to land them an AI-proof job: double majoring
item.description: Doubling majoring is exploding on college campuses—and it could be Gen Z’s secret weapon in a shaky job market.

item.title: Scott Galloway fears a market crash or social crisis in the next year. A top finance professor recommends putting money into baseball cards
item.description: NYU Stern Finance professor told Galloway the market isn't pricing in "a market and economic crisis that is potentially catastrophic."

item.title: How a sold-off bitcoin resembles Amazon and Google after their IPOs
Economic calendar: Shutdown-delayed government data about to start flowing
Fund managers are bullish, B. of A. survey finds. A Fed pause could change that.
What you should know about Cloudflare — and this morning’s internet outages
